paper_title: Classification of finite groups with small proportion of vanishing elements
abstract: We have proved that if the function $\operatorname{P_v}(G)$, measuring the proportion of the elements of a finite group $G$ that are zeros of irreducible characters of $G$, is less than $Â¶{A_7}$, then $\operatorname{P_v}(G)\in \{ \frac{m-1}{m}\mid m=1,2,\cdots ,6 \}$. In this paper, we give a classification of finite groups $G$ such that $\operatorname{P_v}(G)=\frac{m-1}{m}$ for $m=1,2,\cdots ,6$.
publication_venue: arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:2201.00550
